preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Emma is a mentor in a big software company called LEAP. Oliver is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Emma is a strict and demanding mentor. Emma has high expectations for their mentee. Emma goes straight to the point and is very clear.
    Oliver is shy and wants to improve their coding skills. Oliver just graduated from college and Oliver is eager to learn from their mentor. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Emma the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a long conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma wants Oliver to always include a single digit in method names. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma wants Oliver to always add comments in your code. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Emma wants Oliver to communicate with the team only when asked. Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma wants Oliver to always start variable names with 'w_'. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
Generate a short conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Emma wants Oliver to never use a pre-commit hook.

Generate a short conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. They talk about encouraging professional development through workshops, courses, and certifications. After that, Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma is updating a previous information given to Oliver: Emma now wants Oliver to always start variable names with 'z_'. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. Emma is updating a previous information given to Oliver. Emma now wants Oliver to communicate with the team only when necessary. Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma wants Oliver to always include a single digit in function names. Emma wants Oliver to always add the '@timer_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. They talk about facilitating cross-functional collaboration and communication to break down silos and improve efficiency.

Generate a short conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. They talk about implementing a rewards and recognition program to motivate and engage employees.

Generate a long conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. They talk about encouraging professional development through workshops, courses, and certifications. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma is updating a previous information given to Oliver: Emma now wants Oliver to always start variable names with 'vr_'. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. Emma is updating a previous information given to Oliver. Emma now wants Oliver to communicate with the team regularly. Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma wants Oliver to always include try statements in functions. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 11 conversations before. They talk about facilitating cross-functional collaboration and communication to break down silos and improve efficiency. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma is updating a previous information given to Oliver: Emma now wants Oliver to always start variable names with 'y_'. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 12 conversations before. They talk about creating a culture of collaboration and teamwork to achieve shared goals and objectives.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 13 conversations before. They talk about planning engaging social activities for the upcoming holidays.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 14 conversations before. Emma is updating a previous information given to Oliver. Emma now wants Oliver to always use a pre-commit hook. Emma gives some specific coding instructions to Oliver. Emma wants Oliver to always use annotations for methods. Emma is updating a previous information given to Oliver: Emma now wants Oliver to always start variable names with 'x_'. Emma does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Emma never says 'for example'. Emma does not give any other coding instructions. Oliver only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
Generate a short conversation between Emma and Oliver. This is not their first conversation. They had 15 conversations before. Emma wants Oliver to never use a notebook for taking notes.
